definitions.definition: not one nor the other of two things or people

examples.text: They produced two reports, **neither of which** contained any useful suggestions.
‘Which do you like?’ ‘Neither. I think they're both ugly.’

wordOrigin: Middle English: alteration (by association with either) of Old English nawther, contraction of nāhwæther (from nā ‘no’ + hwæther ‘whether’).
